algorithm_technique: Two pointers with a flag to track allowed duplicates
problem_summary_simple: Remove duplicates from a sorted array, allowing each element to appear at most twice.
problem_summary_technical: In-place modification of a sorted array, allowing up to two occurrences of each element using two pointers.
key_insights: The core idea is to allow an element if it's different from the previous or if it's the second occurrence.
A boolean flag 'same' helps track if the current element is a duplicate of the element at 'last'.
The 'last' pointer indicates the end of the valid part of the modified array.
